Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevinin-1SY  (natural AMPs; RaCa15; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: Wood frogRana sylvatica, American bullfrog,Rana catesbeiana, North America

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Also discovered by deep learning. Found in multiple species.Chemical modification:  It contains one disulfide bond: 18, 24.Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 45 uM) and S. aureus (MIC 7 uM). Also active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 8-16 ug/ml), S.enteritidis (MIC >128 ug/ml), and S. aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC 4-8 ug/ml).Toxicity: porcine RBC: HC50 > 128 ug/ml (Richter et al., 2022). Updated 5/2020; 12/2023
Literature Information.Author: Matutte B., Storey KB., Knoop FC., Conlon JM.2000
Literature Information.Title: Induction of synthesis of an antimicrobial peptide in the skin of the freeze-tolerant frog, Rana sylvatica, in response to environmental stimuli.
